turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Byzantine–Bulgarian wars.
turn.1: What was the defeat of Sviatoslav I of Bulgaria?
turn.2: Failing to secure the defense of the Balkan passes, Sviatoslav allowed the Byzantines to penetrate into Moesia and lay siege to the Bulgarian capital Preslav.
turn.4: Although Bulgarians and Russians joined in defending the city, the Byzantines managed to set afire the wooden structures and roofs with missiles, and they took the fortress.
turn.5: What happened after Preslav was taken?
turn.6: Boris II now became a captive of John I Tzimiskes, who continued to pursue the Russians, besieging Sviatoslav in Drăstăr (Silistra) while claiming to act as Boris' ally and protector and treating the Bulgarian monarch with due respect.
turn.7: Did Sviatoslav ever manage to recover?
turn.8: After Sviatoslav had come to terms and set out for Kiev, the Byzantine emperor returned to Constantinople in triumph.
turn.9: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.10: Far from liberating Bulgaria as he had claimed, John brought along Boris II and his family, together with the contents of the Bulgarian imperial treasury in 971.
turn.11: What did they do with him after that?
turn.12: In a public ceremony in Constantinople, Boris II was ritually divested of his imperial insignia and was given the Byzantine court title of "magistros" as compensation.
